intro: Ichnocarpus velutinus, commonly known as the silky burr, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, hairy seeds enclosed in a tough, spiny capsule, which aids in seed dispersal by attaching to animal fur. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
